channel.title: Comments on: Crowdsourcing a learning-to-teach framework
channel.description: iteration, making, building, and coding in education

item.title: By: Brian Vancil
item.dc:creator: Brian Vancil
item.description: The RTOP (Reformed Teaching Observation Protocol) is pretty good when used as a framework for discussing aspects of the lesson. I would second John's call for recording the proceedings to carry out a massively involved debriefing involving multiple teachers. However, I wish our student teaching was more like that in Japan with more focus on fewer lessons so that this kind of thing could begin earlier.

item.title: By: Tina C
item.dc:creator: Tina C
item.description: I love this. I remember having specific observation protocols in college, but the preservice teacher who was observing me this year was just supposed to write down things he liked and didn't like (so vague!). Hope you get lots more suggestions.
